alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gibson; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 9:28AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Carroll, Gibson and Henderson. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milan, Lexington, Natchez Trace State Park, Natchez Trace State Forest, Atwood, Bargerton, Parkers Crossroads, Wildersville, Trezevant, Clarksburg, McLemoresville, Hickory Flat, Howley, Mount Gilead, Jumbo, Cedar Grove, Scott Hill, Union Cross, Lavinia and Whitthorne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
